pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35: See Kd 18:1.2.22 for the correct interpretation of this line.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū can be read either as referring to two monks, Mettiya and Bhūmajaka, or as a group of monks led by these two. I have not been able to find any clear evidence that it refers to a group, and so I prefer the more straightforward reading that it only refers to the two monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14: “Gatehouse” renders koṭṭhaka. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21: For the rendering of saṅghāṭi as “upper robe”, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.19: “Rapist” renders dūsita. See dūseti in Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.13: “Expel” renders nāsetha. For a discussion of the verb nāseti, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.4: It is interesting to note that both uposatha and pavāraṇā are here used as distinct from saṅghakamma, suggesting neither was regarded as saṅghakamma proper. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for a further discussion of these two words.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.4.2: Sp 1.387: No kappetīti na saddahati, “No kappeti: he does not believe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.6: See Bu Pc 2:1.2.33 for the rule on abusive speech.
